note.p: Birth: West Derby, Liverpool, Lancashire, England (18 September 1854)
Education: Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1876), MA

Career: Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge; (1877); Lecturer in Mathematics, Cambridge University; Demonstrator, Cavendish Laboratory (by 1881); Assistant Director, Cavendish Laboratory; Principal, University College, Liverpool (1898-1899); Director, National Physical Laboratory (1899-1919); Zaharoff Professor of Aviation and Director, Department of Aeronautics, Imperial College, London (1920-1923)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 29-56, plate, by Rayleigh and F J Selby
References: Russell Moseley, 'Government Science and the Royal Society: The Control of the National Physical Laboratory in the Inter-War Years' in NR 1980 vol 35 pp 167-193
